p: One of the postulated mechanisms is that the phytochemicals interact with and disrupt the phospholipid cell membranes, resulting in increased cell permeability, leading to the depletion of cell components ( Omojate et al., 2014). Phenolic compounds inhibit hydrolytic enzymes thus disrupting both the energy production and the production of structural components ( Pandey & Kumar, 2013). In bacterial cells, phytochemicals cause cell content coagulation and also inactivate deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) which is manifested as growth retardation ( Omojate et al., 2014).
